Package co.cask.cdap.api.app

An Application is a logical grouping of Streams, Datasets, Flows, Procedures, and other deployable elements.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Application Defines a CDAP Application.
ApplicationConfigurer Configures a CDAP Application.
 

Class Summary
AbstractApplication A support class for Applications which reduces repetition and results in a more readable configuration.
ApplicationContext Provides access to the environment, application configuration, and application (deployment) arguments.
 

Package co.cask.cdap.api.app Description

An Application is a logical grouping of Streams, Datasets, Flows, Procedures, and other deployable elements.

Application

Every Application must either implement the Application interface or extend the AbstractApplication class. Extending AbstractApplication is simpler and helps produce cleaner code.

To create a CDAP Application, first begin by extending the AbstractApplication class, then implement its configure() method. In the configure method, specify the Application's metadata (its name and description), and declare and configure each of the Application elements.

Example usage: 

 
 public class MyApp extends AbstractApplication {
   @Override
   public void configure() {
     setName("myApp");
     setDescription("My Sample Application");
     addStream(new Stream("myAppStream"));
     createDataset("myCounters", "KeyValueTable");
     addFlow(new MyAppFlow());
     addProcedure(new MyAppQuery());
     addMapReduce(new MyMapReduceJob());
     addWorkflow(new MyAppWorkflow());
   }
 }

Stream

Streams are the primary means for pushing data into CDAP.

See Stream for details.

Dataset

A Dataset defines the storage and retrieval of data. In addition to the several Dataset implementations CDAP provides, you can also implement your own Custom Datasets.

See Dataset for details.

Flow

Flows are user-implemented real-time stream processors. A Flow contains one or more Flowlets that are wired into a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG).

In order to define a Flow, implement the Flow interface and implement the Flow.configure() method.

See Flow for details.

Flowlet

A Flowlet is a processing unit of a Flow that defines business logic for processing events received on input. Flowlets can also emit new events to the output for downstream processing. In other words, Flowlets pass Data Objects between one another. Each Flowlet is able to perform custom logic and execute data operations for each individual data object processed.

See Flowlet for details.

Procedure

A Procedure handles queries from external systems to the CDAP instance and performs arbitrary server-side processing on demand.

To define a Procedure, implement the Procedure interface.

See Procedure for details.
